title: ParkPie Landing Website
summary: Architected a high-performance marketing platform using Next.js 16 and React 19, achieving a 100% Lighthouse performance score via zero-layout-shift font loading, edge-cached content, and semantic HTML.
highlights: Engineered a cost-effective 'Headless CMS' solution using Airtable and Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR).
Secured public infrastructure with a defence-in-depth strategy (Fixed-window rate limiting, Honeypot, Zod schemas).
Mitigated critical React2Shell exposure (CVE-2025-55182) via zero-downtime upgrade.
Orchestrated automated SEO pipelines generating dynamic sitemaps, RSS feeds, and Open Graph metadata.

title: Cheap.Guide App Backend
summary: Served as Principal Backend Engineer & Solution Architect delivering a Spring Boot backend with REST APIs for auth, posts, geospatial search, AI moderation, and notifications.
highlights: Integrated Firebase Auth (JWT) with role-based access control across 30+ endpoints.
Replaced Redis with Caffeine in-memory caching, saving ~$400/year while achieving sub-millisecond retrieval.
Set up async workflows with Google Pub/Sub handling 16 concurrent threads.
Provisioned GCP infrastructure via Terraform and established CI/CD with GitHub Actions and multi-stage Docker builds.

title: ParkPie App Backend
summary: Led backend and AI development for a geospatial-first Django + PostGIS backend with optimised spatial queries.
highlights: Pioneered an agentic AI pipeline with LangGraph and LangChain for multi-step reasoning (hybrid cloud/local inference).
Deployed a scalable vector database with pgvector in PostgreSQL 17 to power semantic RAG search.
Configured CI/CD with Docker Compose and GitHub Actions, enforcing TDD, mypy, and ruff.
Added observability with LangSmith and OpenTelemetry + LGTM stack to monitor agent workflows.

title: Social Media Analytics System
summary: Spearheaded a team to deliver a cloud-native analytics system for the Australian federal election, coordinating sprint planning and cross-module integration.
highlights: Developed a scalable Reddit harvester with Fission, ingesting and normalising 168k+ posts in real-time.
Built a comment-tree collector enriching sentiment analysis, exposed via an Elasticsearch REST API.
Created interactive Jupyter Notebook visualisations for filtering and trend analysis.
